whatIsCashu.a: Cashu is an eCash protocol based on the Bitcoin Lightning Network. It enables fast and affordable payments while protecting privacy using encrypted tokens (eCash) issued by a Mint server. By adopting the Chaumian ecash method, even the Mint cannot know who is using which tokens.

isCustodial.a: No, Cashu eCash is different from traditional custodial wallets. eCash tokens are stored only in your browser, and the Mint server does not hold the tokens. The Mint only issues and redeems tokens and cannot track who holds which tokens.

advantages.q: What are the main advantages of eCash?
advantages.a: 1) Privacy: Even the Mint cannot know who is using which tokens. 2) Instant payments: Immediate sending and receiving via Lightning Network. 3) Low fees: Optimized for micropayments. 4) Offline transactions: Token exchange possible without internet.

howToReceive.q: How do I receive Lightning payments?
howToReceive.a: Click the "Receive" button on the wallet page, enter the amount, and generate an invoice. When the QR code appears, the other party can scan it to make payment. Once payment is complete, it's automatically converted to eCash and added to your balance.

howToSend.q: How do I send Lightning payments?
howToSend.a: Click the "Send" button and paste a Lightning invoice (lnbc...). Lightning addresses (user@domain) also work by entering the amount, which will automatically generate an invoice. A fee reserve is included, and any remaining amount is returned as eCash.

whyBackup.a: eCash tokens are stored only in your browser's local storage. If you delete browser data or clear cache, your balance will be permanently lost. Make sure to download the backup file (JSON) and keep it safe. With a backup file, you can restore at any time.

multiDevice.q: Can I use it on multiple devices?
multiDevice.a: Yes, you can restore by transferring the backup file to another device. However, using the same tokens simultaneously on multiple devices can cause double-spending issues, so it's recommended to use only one device at a time.

howFees.a: Lightning transfers include a routing fee reserve. If more is reserved than the actual fee, the remaining amount is automatically returned as eCash change. The Mint pays the fee on your behalf, and in most cases, you'll receive the difference back as the reserve exceeds the actual cost.

trustMint.a: The Mint's role is to redeem Bitcoin for eCash tokens. It's important to choose a trustworthy Mint, and if needed, you can move (swap) tokens to another Mint. The app currently uses a default Mint, with support for multiple Mints planned for the future.

lostTokens.q: What if tokens are stolen or lost?
lostTokens.a: eCash tokens are similar to physical cash. Without a backup file, they cannot be recovered, so make sure to keep them safe. We recommend storing backup files on encrypted USB drives or cloud storage.

blindSignature.a: It's a core technology of Chaumian eCash—a cryptographic technique that prevents the Mint from knowing the token's content when signing it. This ensures complete privacy as even the Mint cannot track who is using which tokens.

tracked.a: No, thanks to Cashu's blind signature technology, even the Mint cannot know which tokens are being used by whom. Transaction history is not recorded on the blockchain, providing complete privacy. However, the Mint can only see the amount at the time of issuance/redemption.

privacy.a: All eCash tokens are stored only in the browser's local storage and are not transmitted to the server. The Mint cannot identify token owners, and the app does not collect any personal information.

mintHacked.q: What happens if the Mint is hacked?
mintHacked.a: If the Mint's private key is compromised, attackers can issue unlimited tokens. However, your tokens are safely stored in your browser, and you can immediately move them to another Mint or withdraw via Lightning. Choosing a trustworthy Mint is important.

browserExtensions.a: Suspicious browser extensions can access local storage and steal tokens. Only install trusted extensions, and keep significant amounts safe in backup files.

balanceGone.a: Clearing browser storage permanently deletes eCash tokens. If you have a backup file, you can restore it using the "Restore" button. Without a backup, recovery is impossible, so make sure to back up regularly.

noBalance.q: Balance not showing after invoice payment
noBalance.a: Payment confirmation can take up to 2 minutes. Try refreshing the page or wait a moment. If it still doesn't resolve, you can manually recover by finding the quote ID in the backend logs.

failedButDeducted.q: Transfer failed but balance was deducted
failedButDeducted.a: When a transfer fails, the used tokens should remain and not be burned. If your balance was deducted, try refreshing the browser. If the problem persists, restore from backup file.

addressNotWorking.a: When sending to a Lightning address, you must enter an amount. Check that the address format is correct (user@domain) and that the recipient's Lightning address is active.

moreQuestions.a: If your issue isn't resolved by the FAQ above, please contact onebitebitcoin@proton.me. We'll respond as quickly as possible.
